paper_metadata.title: Evaluation of a community-based poverty alleviation program: FXBVillage model in Rwanda and Uganda

program_information.program_name_citation: We evaluate the three-year community-based FXBVillage poverty-alleviation model, which provides extremely poor families with sustained social support and graduated material support for education, healthcare, housing, nutrition, and income-generation.
program_information.country_citation: We combine a pre/post analysis of participant households in Rwanda (n = 912) and Uganda (n = 628)
program_information.target_population_citation: We evaluate the three-year community-based FXBVillage poverty-alleviation model, which provides extremely poor families with sustained social support

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Increases among relevant household characteristics included (in Rwanda/Uganda): C3 meals/day (5-88%)/(44-86%), school attendance 5-17 years (79-97%)/(64-89%), adequate school supplies (7-97%)/ (4-71%), and communal financial support if needed (27-98%)/(29-87%)
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We combine a pre/post analysis of participant households in Rwanda (n = 912) and Uganda (n = 628) with construction and assessment of a combined multivariable household wealth index comparing FXBVillage data with national Demographic Health Surveys
